20110112030159.000|20110112030202.000|TR0|sadness fades or the tempers cool.
20110112030202.000|20110112030204.000|TR0|

20110112030534.000|20110112030536.000|TR0|say that mental illness doesn't equal 
20110112030536.000|20110112030539.000|TR0|violence.  And the times when it does, 
20110112030539.000|20110112030541.000|TR0|it's frequently suicidal, not homicidal 
20110112030541.000|20110112030543.000|TR0|violence.

20110112030601.000|20110112030604.000|TR0|mentally unstable person in the class that

20110112030610.000|20110112030613.000|TR0|to class with an automatic weapon," she

20110112030626.000|20110112030628.000|TR0|
20110112030628.000|20110112030631.000|TR0|BEN MCGAHEE, FORMER MATH INSTRUCTOR OF 
20110112030631.000|20110112030633.000|TR0|JARED LEE LOUGHNER:  This guy was mentally 
20110112030633.000|20110112030635.000|TR0|disturbed.  He was very isolated.  I was 
20110112030635.000|20110112030637.000|TR0|scared of what he could do.  I wasn't 
20110112030637.000|20110112030640.000|TR0|scared of him physically, but I was scared

20110112030642.000|20110112030644.000|TR0|
20110112030644.000|20110112030646.000|TR0|(END VIDEO CLIP)
20110112030646.000|20110112030649.000|TR0|
20110112030649.000|20110112030651.000|TR0|COOPER:  That's one of his teachers.
20110112030651.000|20110112030653.000|TR0|
20110112030653.000|20110112030655.000|TR0|In fact, starting in February last year, 
20110112030655.000|20110112030658.000|TR0|Loughner's erratic behavior led to five 
20110112030658.000|20110112030700.000|TR0|confrontations with campus police, not -- 
20110112030700.000|20110112030702.000|TR0|not city police, campus police.
20110112030702.000|20110112030705.000|TR0|
20110112030705.000|20110112030707.000|TR0|By September 29, he was suspended, and 
20110112030707.000|20110112030709.000|TR0|police, campus police, delivered a letter 
20110112030709.000|20110112030711.000|TR0|to him at his parents' home.  Then, on the 
20110112030711.000|20110112030714.000|TR0|7th of October, a follow-up telling 
20110112030714.000|20110112030716.000|TR0|Loughner he may only return after 
20110112030716.000|20110112030718.000|TR0|obtaining a mental health clearance, 
20110112030718.000|20110112030720.000|TR0|showing his presence at the college would 
20110112030720.000|20110112030723.000|TR0|not endanger himself or others.  He never 
20110112030723.000|20110112030725.000|TR0|returned.
20110112030725.000|20110112030727.000|TR0|
20110112030727.000|20110112030729.000|TR0|As for the school -- as far as the school 
20110112030729.000|20110112030732.000|TR0|was concerned, they had done their jobs.  
20110112030732.000|20110112030734.000|TR0|They had protected their students.  But 
20110112030734.000|20110112030736.000|TR0|what about the community beyond the campus?
20110112030736.000|20110112030738.000|TR0|
20110112030738.000|20110112030741.000|TR0|You see, Arizona actually has a law that a 
20110112030741.000|20110112030743.000|TR0|lot of other states don't have that might 
20110112030743.000|20110112030745.000|TR0|have made it possible for the school to do 
20110112030745.000|20110112030747.000|TR0|something.  Under Arizona law, the college 
20110112030747.000|20110112030750.000|TR0|could have called a 24-hour government-run 
20110112030750.000|20110112030752.000|TR0|mental health hot line with their concerns.
20110112030752.000|20110112030754.000|TR0|
20110112030754.000|20110112030757.000|TR0|In fact, in Arizona, any person who knew 
20110112030757.000|20110112030759.000|TR0|Jared Loughner and had concerns about him 
20110112030759.000|20110112030801.000|TR0|could have petitioned a court to get him a 
20110112030801.000|20110112030803.000|TR0|psychiatric evaluation.  The law's almost 
20110112030803.000|20110112030806.000|TR0|unique.  Only a handful of other states 
20110112030806.000|20110112030808.000|TR0|use it.  Most states require that a person 
20110112030808.000|20110112030810.000|TR0|poses an immediate danger to himself or 
20110112030810.000|20110112030812.000|TR0|others before he can be involuntarily 
20110112030812.000|20110112030815.000|TR0|treated.
20110112030815.000|20110112030817.000|TR0|
20110112030817.000|20110112030819.000|TR0|In Arizona, the hurdle is far lower.  The 
20110112030819.000|20110112030821.000|TR0|law only requires that a person be judged 
20110112030821.000|20110112030824.000|TR0|persistently or acutely disabled or as 
20110112030824.000|20110112030826.000|TR0|gravely disabled.  Under that standard, 
20110112030826.000|20110112030828.000|TR0|Jared Loughner might have gotten seen, 
20110112030828.000|20110112030830.000|TR0|might have gotten evaluated, might have 
20110112030830.000|20110112030833.000|TR0|gotten treated, might have been prevented 
20110112030833.000|20110112030835.000|TR0|at least from buying a gun.       At this 
20110112030835.000|20110112030837.000|TR0|point, there's no evidence anyone 
20110112030837.000|20110112030839.000|TR0|petitioned a court, not his parents, not 
20110112030839.000|20110112030842.000|TR0|his classmates, not the campus police or 
20110112030842.000|20110112030844.000|TR0|school administration.  Again, we don't 
20110112030844.000|20110112030846.000|TR0|know if he was getting private counseling, 
20110112030846.000|20110112030848.000|TR0|but, so far, there's no evidence of that.
20110112030848.000|20110112030851.000|TR0|
20110112030851.000|20110112030853.000|TR0|Joining us now is forensic psychiatrist 
20110112030853.000|20110112030855.000|TR0|Helen Morrison, senior legal analyst 
20110112030855.000|20110112030858.000|TR0|Jeffrey Toobin, and Drew Griffin of the 
20110112030858.000|20110112030900.000|TR0|CNN Special Investigations Unit.
20110112030900.000|20110112030902.000|TR0|
20110112030902.000|20110112030904.000|TR0|Drew, you talked to the school 
20110112030904.000|20110112030907.000|TR0|administrators.  They felt their main 
20110112030907.000|20110112030909.000|TR0|responsibility was just protecting kids on 
20110112030909.000|20110112030911.000|TR0|campus.  Do we know, did they make any 
20110112030911.000|20110112030913.000|TR0|effort to contact anybody with their 
20110112030913.000|20110112030916.000|TR0|concerns outside the campus?
20110112030916.000|20110112030918.000|TR0|
20110112030918.000|20110112030920.000|TR0|DREW GRIFFIN, CNN INVESTIGATIVE 
20110112030920.000|20110112030922.000|TR0|CORRESPONDENT:  Just the parents. That was 
20110112030922.000|20110112030925.000|TR0|their main concern, to bring the parents 
20110112030925.000|20110112030927.000|TR0|in, to let them know the situation, to let 
20110112030927.000|20110112030929.000|TR0|them know they thought their son needed 
20110112030929.000|20110112030931.000|TR0|mental evaluation before he could return 
20110112030931.000|20110112030934.000|TR0|back to class.
20110112030934.000|20110112030936.000|TR0|
20110112030936.000|20110112030938.000|TR0|But, again, they were following their 
20110112030938.000|20110112030940.000|TR0|code, and basically kicking him off campus 
20110112030940.000|20110112030943.000|TR0|because he was violating the code of 
20110112030943.000|20110112030945.000|TR0|conduct that the school had.  They weren't 
20110112030945.000|20110112030947.000|TR0|really concerned that he was a threat, per 
20110112030947.000|20110112030949.000|TR0|se.  They were concerned that he was 
20110112030949.000|20110112030952.000|TR0|becoming a real disruptive person inside 
20110112030952.000|20110112030954.000|TR0|classrooms and making it impossible for 
20110112030954.000|20110112030956.000|TR0|other students to learn.

20110112031010.000|20110112031012.000|TR0|COOPER:  Sorry.
20110112031012.000|20110112031014.000|TR0|
20110112031014.000|20110112031017.000|TR0|Jeff, in so many other -- other cases, we 
20110112031017.000|20110112031019.000|TR0|have heard of, you know, parents who have 
20110112031019.000|20110112031021.000|TR0|kids who are schizophrenic or have some 
20110112031021.000|20110112031023.000|TR0|sort of mental instability and have said, 
20110112031023.000|20110112031026.000|TR0|look, unless I can prove to authorities 
20110112031026.000|20110112031028.000|TR0|that my child is going to -- you know, in 
20110112031028.000|20110112031030.000|TR0|imminent harm to himself or to someone

20110112031032.000|20110112031035.000|TR0|No one will get involved.
20110112031035.000|20110112031037.000|TR0|
20110112031037.000|20110112031039.000|TR0|JEFFREY TOOBIN, CNN SENIOR LEGAL ANALYST:  
20110112031039.000|20110112031041.000|TR0|That's right.
20110112031041.000|20110112031044.000|TR0|
20110112031044.000|20110112031046.000|TR0|And what makes this Arizona law so unusual 
20110112031046.000|20110112031048.000|TR0|is that there was an outlet.  There was an 
20110112031048.000|20110112031050.000|TR0|opportunity to go forward and get him

20110112032438.000|20110112032440.000|TR0|COOPER:  You know, Dr. Phil, it seems 
20110112032440.000|20110112032442.000|TR0|there were plenty of people who crossed 
20110112032442.000|20110112032444.000|TR0|paths with the alleged shooter and -- and 
20110112032444.000|20110112032447.000|TR0|were alarmed enough to -- by his behavior

20110112032449.000|20110112032451.000|TR0|school, people in the neighborhood.  Do 
20110112032451.000|20110112032453.000|TR0|you think that everything that could have 
20110112032453.000|20110112032456.000|TR0|been done was done in this case?
20110112032456.000|20110112032458.000|TR0|
20110112032458.000|20110112032500.000|TR0|DR. PHIL MCGRAW, HOST, "DR. PHIL":  Well, 
20110112032500.000|20110112032502.000|TR0|Anderson, this is a real problem.
20110112032502.000|20110112032505.000|TR0|
20110112032505.000|20110112032507.000|TR0|And let me kind of describe for you what 
20110112032507.000|20110112032509.000|TR0|the problem is.  Even if he had 
20110112032509.000|20110112032511.000|TR0|encountered professionals, psychologists 
20110112032511.000|20110112032514.000|TR0|or psychiatrists, even people that were 
20110112032514.000|20110112032516.000|TR0|trained to look for erratic behavior or 
20110112032516.000|20110112032518.000|TR0|different types of pathology, the problem 
20110112032518.000|20110112032520.000|TR0|is, we have a hard time predicting when 
20110112032520.000|20110112032523.000|TR0|someone is going to go off and do 
20110112032523.000|20110112032525.000|TR0|something like this.
20110112032525.000|20110112032527.000|TR0|
20110112032527.000|20110112032529.000|TR0|For example, you know, there might be 
20110112032529.000|20110112032532.000|TR0|1,000 people that would do exactly what 
20110112032532.000|20110112032534.000|TR0|this person had done, rambling e-mails, 
20110112032534.000|20110112032536.000|TR0|erratic behavior observed by others in a 
20110112032536.000|20110112032539.000|TR0|classroom, showing disturbed thought 
20110112032539.000|20110112032541.000|TR0|through psychotic processes, things of 
20110112032541.000|20110112032543.000|TR0|this nature, that never do anything 
20110112032543.000|20110112032545.000|TR0|violent.  They never aggress against 
20110112032545.000|20110112032548.000|TR0|anyone.
20110112032548.000|20110112032550.000|TR0|
20110112032550.000|20110112032552.000|TR0|So, it's very difficult to say which one 
20110112032552.000|20110112032554.000|TR0|is going to be the one that actually does 
20110112032554.000|20110112032557.000|TR0|something like that.  So, when you look at 
20110112032557.000|20110112032559.000|TR0|it after the fact, it's -- it's -- you 
20110112032559.000|20110112032601.000|TR0|look at it and say, wow, look at all these 
20110112032601.000|20110112032603.000|TR0|things we know.  Classmates were saying he 
20110112032603.000|20110112032606.000|TR0|was scaring them and disturbing them.  He 
20110112032606.000|20110112032608.000|TR0|was writing things on the Internet.  He 
20110112032608.000|20110112032610.000|TR0|was really being critical of the 
20110112032610.000|20110112032612.000|TR0|government.
20110112032612.000|20110112032615.000|TR0|
20110112032615.000|20110112032617.000|TR0|But so many people do that and never do 
20110112032617.000|20110112032619.000|TR0|anything.  So, it's difficult to actually 
20110112032619.000|20110112032621.000|TR0|predict it.
20110112032621.000|20110112032624.000|TR0|
20110112032624.000|20110112032626.000|TR0|COOPER:  It's also difficult -- I mean, we 
20110112032626.000|20110112032628.000|TR0|have heard so many cases -- and, again, we 
20110112032628.000|20110112032631.000|TR0|don't know the details of this guy's 
20110112032631.000|20110112032633.000|TR0|family, what his parents did or did not

20110112032711.000|20110112032713.000|TR0|MCGRAW:  Well, that's a real problem.
20110112032713.000|20110112032716.000|TR0|

20110112032718.000|20110112032720.000|TR0|too high.  But what you're talking about

20110112032732.000|20110112032734.000|TR0|Now, when you're in a parent situation, 
20110112032734.000|20110112032736.000|TR0|once a child becomes 18, you can't compel 
20110112032736.000|20110112032738.000|TR0|them getting help.  You can't compel them 
20110112032738.000|20110112032741.000|TR0|getting therapy.  So, what you have to do

20110112032743.000|20110112032745.000|TR0|something system-wise that would take them

20110112032747.000|20110112032750.000|TR0|hill to climb.
20110112032750.000|20110112032752.000|TR0|
20110112032752.000|20110112032754.000|TR0|COOPER:  Yes.  It's difficult for family

20110112032801.000|20110112032803.000|TR0|Kaczynski, turned in by his own brother.

20110112032805.000|20110112032808.000|TR0|What do you -- what kind of responsibility

20110112032812.000|20110112032814.000|TR0|potentially dangerous in their midst?
20110112032814.000|20110112032817.000|TR0|
20110112032817.000|20110112032819.000|TR0|MCGRAW:  Well, I think you do have a 
20110112032819.000|20110112032821.000|TR0|responsibility at that point.  I mean, the 
20110112032821.000|20110112032823.000|TR0|parents probably know and have better -- 
20110112032823.000|20110112032826.000|TR0|know their child and have better access 
20110112032826.000|20110112032828.000|TR0|than anyone.
20110112032828.000|20110112032830.000|TR0|
20110112032830.000|20110112032833.000|TR0|And if you're in a situation where they 
20110112032833.000|20110112032835.000|TR0|are showing behavior that is suggestive, 
20110112032835.000|20110112032837.000|TR0|they're making threats, they have weapons, 
20110112032837.000|20110112032839.000|TR0|they're starting to do dangerous sort of 
20110112032839.000|20110112032842.000|TR0|things, I think we do need to reach out 
20110112032842.000|20110112032844.000|TR0|and get some help.
20110112032844.000|20110112032846.000|TR0|
20110112032846.000|20110112032848.000|TR0|Now, maybe you call the authorities; maybe 
20110112032848.000|20110112032851.000|TR0|you call a trusted friend; maybe you talk 
20110112032851.000|20110112032853.000|TR0|to someone at the church; you call a 
20110112032853.000|20110112032855.000|TR0|psychologist, or a counselor.  But, 
20110112032855.000|20110112032857.000|TR0|sometimes, you -- there comes a point when 
20110112032857.000|20110112032900.000|TR0|you say, I'm in over my head; I need to 
20110112032900.000|20110112032902.000|TR0|reach out and get some help here.
20110112032902.000|20110112032904.000|TR0|
20110112032904.000|20110112032906.000|TR0|And I think, furthermore, people need to 
20110112032906.000|20110112032909.000|TR0|understand that there are community mental 
20110112032909.000|20110112032911.000|TR0|health centers that work with people based 
20110112032911.000|20110112032913.000|TR0|on their ability to pay.  So, you don't 
20110112032913.000|20110112032915.000|TR0|have to be able to go hire a psychologist 
20110112032915.000|20110112032918.000|TR0|or a psychiatrist if you don't have 
20110112032918.000|20110112032920.000|TR0|insurance.  There are usually state and 
20110112032920.000|20110112032922.000|TR0|county organizations and agencies that 
20110112032922.000|20110112032924.000|TR0|will provide some type of help.
20110112032924.000|20110112032927.000|TR0|
20110112032927.000|20110112032929.000|TR0|COOPER:  And -- and it's worth noting it's 
20110112032929.000|20110112032931.000|TR0|important not to demonize someone with a 
20110112032931.000|20110112032934.000|TR0|mental illness, schizophrenia or something 
20110112032934.000|20110112032936.000|TR0|because, as you said, the statistics show 
20110112032936.000|20110112032938.000|TR0|the majority of them do not end up acting 
20110112032938.000|20110112032940.000|TR0|out violently.
20110112032940.000|20110112032943.000|TR0|
20110112032943.000|20110112032945.000|TR0|The -- you know, I guess one of the big 
20110112032945.000|20110112032947.000|TR0|problems, too, is, if somebody is severely 
20110112032947.000|20110112032949.000|TR0|mentally ill, they often don't see 
20110112032949.000|20110112032952.000|TR0|themselves or thinking of themselves as 
20110112032952.000|20110112032954.000|TR0|mentally ill.  They don't want to stay on 
20110112032954.000|20110112032956.000|TR0|medication.
20110112032956.000|20110112032958.000|TR0|
20110112032958.000|20110112033001.000|TR0|Can you convince someone like that?  Or -- 
20110112033001.000|20110112033003.000|TR0|or -- I mean, at that -- it's a -- it's a 
20110112033003.000|20110112033005.000|TR0|hard thing to do.
20110112033005.000|20110112033007.000|TR0|
20110112033007.000|20110112033010.000|TR0|MCGRAW:  It is very difficult, because, 
20110112033010.000|20110112033012.000|TR0|the more you get out of touch with 
20110112033012.000|20110112033014.000|TR0|reality, the more you have breaks with 
20110112033014.000|20110112033016.000|TR0|reality and live in a fantasy world, which 
20110112033016.000|20110112033019.000|TR0|is one of the criteria we use for defining 
20110112033019.000|20110112033021.000|TR0|psychosis, the less insight that person's 
20110112033021.000|20110112033023.000|TR0|going to have.
20110112033023.000|20110112033026.000|TR0|
20110112033026.000|20110112033028.000|TR0|Their ability to step back, look at 
20110112033028.000|20110112033030.000|TR0|themselves and say, wow, I am truly out of 
20110112033030.000|20110112033032.000|TR0|control here and I need some help, is -- 
20110112033032.000|20110112033035.000|TR0|is very poor.
20110112033035.000|20110112033037.000|TR0|
20110112033037.000|20110112033039.000|TR0|COOPER:  So, I mean, when you see an 
20110112033039.000|20110112033041.000|TR0|incident like this, what's -- I mean, what 
20110112033041.000|20110112033044.000|TR0|do you take away from it?  What's the 
20110112033044.000|20110112033046.000|TR0|lesson?
20110112033046.000|20110112033048.000|TR0|
20110112033048.000|20110112033050.000|TR0|MCGRAW:  Well, it's very frustrating to 
20110112033050.000|20110112033053.000|TR0|me, as -- as a mental health professional, 
20110112033053.000|20110112033055.000|TR0|that we don't have a better ability to 
20110112033055.000|20110112033057.000|TR0|predict this kind of thing.
20110112033057.000|20110112033059.000|TR0|
20110112033059.000|20110112033102.000|TR0|And, you know, I hear a lot of theories 
20110112033102.000|20110112033104.000|TR0|out there, that this was political 
20110112033104.000|20110112033106.000|TR0|activism or whatever.  To me, from 
20110112033106.000|20110112033108.000|TR0|everything I can gather, my personal 
20110112033108.000|20110112033111.000|TR0|opinion is, this was a mental 
20110112033111.000|20110112033113.000|TR0|illness-driven aggressive attack.  And I 
20110112033113.000|20110112033115.000|TR0|think it is so tragically terrible that

20110112033923.000|20110112033926.000|TR0|before. Is that because this is the point 
20110112033926.000|20110112033928.000|TR0|at which the swelling of her head reaches 
20110112033928.000|20110112033930.000|TR0|its greatest point?

20110112033932.000|20110112033935.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Yes.  That's exactly right.  I 
20110112033935.000|20110112033937.000|TR0|mean, you can sort of chart that, you 
20110112033937.000|20110112033939.000|TR0|know, based on patients who have had 
20110112033939.000|20110112033941.000|TR0|similar injuries. And around the 72-hour 
20110112033941.000|20110112033944.000|TR0|mark or so is when you sort of have the 
20110112033944.000|20110112033946.000|TR0|maximal swelling.  So if it hasn't gotten 
20110112033946.000|20110112033948.000|TR0|-- become bad or caused problems up to

20110112033950.000|20110112033953.000|TR0|bit of a sigh of relief, saying probably

20110112034002.000|20110112034004.000|TR0|
20110112034004.000|20110112034006.000|TR0|COOPER:  You know, they thought and said 
20110112034006.000|20110112034008.000|TR0|al along and we've been reporting.  In 
20110112034008.000|20110112034011.000|TR0|fact, I just said a few minutes ago that 
20110112034011.000|20110112034013.000|TR0|the bullet went from back to front.  Now 
20110112034013.000|20110112034015.000|TR0|they're saying it went from front to back. 
20110112034015.000|20110112034018.000|TR0| I hadn't heard that until just now.  
20110112034018.000|20110112034020.000|TR0|You've written papers about this.  How 
20110112034020.000|20110112034022.000|TR0|difficult is it to assess which direction 
20110112034022.000|20110112034024.000|TR0|the bullet traveled?
20110112034024.000|20110112034027.000|TR0|
20110112034027.000|20110112034029.000|TR0|GUPTA:  This will surprise people, but it 
20110112034029.000|20110112034031.000|TR0|can actually be quite challenging.  I 
20110112034031.000|20110112034033.000|TR0|mean, if someone is shot, you know, where 
20110112034033.000|20110112034036.000|TR0|the -- where the gunpowder from the blast 
20110112034036.000|20110112034038.000|TR0|actually create -- you can see that 
20110112034038.000|20110112034040.000|TR0|gunpowder on someone's skin, then you 
20110112034040.000|20110112034042.000|TR0|obviously know that that's probably the 
20110112034042.000|20110112034045.000|TR0|entry point.
20110112034045.000|20110112034047.000|TR0|
20110112034047.000|20110112034049.000|TR0|But if you have a certain types of bullet, 
20110112034049.000|20110112034051.000|TR0|for example, fully jacketed bullets that 
20110112034051.000|20110112034054.000|TR0|aren't going to cause a lot of -- they 
20110112034054.000|20110112034056.000|TR0|won't do that sort of explosion effect 
20110112034056.000|20110112034058.000|TR0|inside, it can be difficult to say exactly 
20110112034058.000|20110112034100.000|TR0|what is entry, what is exit.  The exit 
20110112034100.000|20110112034103.000|TR0|wound is sometimes a little bit bigger 
20110112034103.000|20110112034105.000|TR0|than the entrance wound.  And also looking 
20110112034105.000|20110112034107.000|TR0|at the bone fragments from the skull at 
20110112034107.000|20110112034109.000|TR0|the entry site, you'll see those bone 
20110112034109.000|20110112034112.000|TR0|fragments sort of pushing toward the 
20110112034112.000|20110112034114.000|TR0|brain; at the exit you'll see the 
20110112034114.000|20110112034116.000|TR0|fragments not pushing toward the brain, 
20110112034116.000|20110112034119.000|TR0|pushing outside.
20110112034119.000|20110112034121.000|TR0|
20110112034121.000|20110112034123.000|TR0|But despite all that, it can be 
20110112034123.000|20110112034125.000|TR0|challenging.  And I have to tell you 
20110112034125.000|20110112034128.000|TR0|having done these operations, it doesn't 
20110112034128.000|20110112034130.000|TR0|really matter to the doctors who are doing 
20110112034130.000|20110112034132.000|TR0|the surgery.  They need to do the job, 
20110112034132.000|20110112034134.000|TR0|which is to decompress the brain, stop the 
20110112034134.000|20110112034137.000|TR0|bleeding, and where the bullet entered or 
20110112034137.000|20110112034139.000|TR0|exited is sort of a secondary issue for 
20110112034139.000|20110112034141.000|TR0|them.
20110112034141.000|20110112034143.000|TR0|
20110112034143.000|20110112034146.000|TR0|COOPER:  It's actually -- because I talked 
20110112034146.000|20110112034148.000|TR0|to somebody, a witness yesterday who 
20110112034148.000|20110112034150.000|TR0|actually -- a medical personnel who helped 
20110112034150.000|20110112034152.000|TR0|on the scene who said that he thought he 
20110112034152.000|20110112034155.000|TR0|had seen the shooting and thought he had 
20110112034155.000|20110112034157.000|TR0|seen the guy shooting from the rear.  
20110112034157.000|20110112034159.000|TR0|Anyway, I guess we'll learn more as the 
20110112034159.000|20110112034201.000|TR0|investigation continues.       Some of the 
20110112034201.000|20110112034204.000|TR0|doctors have actually been training 
20110112034204.000|20110112034206.000|TR0|overseas in Iraq or Afghanistan, and have 
20110112034206.000|20110112034208.000|TR0|expertise and kind of, you know, large 
20110112034208.000|20110112034211.000|TR0|triage situations.  That can only help in 
20110112034211.000|20110112034213.000|TR0|a situation where you suddenly have a 
20110112034213.000|20110112034215.000|TR0|large number of incoming wounded and -- 
20110112034215.000|20110112034217.000|TR0|with serious injuries.
20110112034217.000|20110112034220.000|TR0|
20110112034220.000|20110112034222.000|TR0|GUPTA:  Yes.  You know, and one of the -- 
20110112034222.000|20110112034224.000|TR0|one of the big sort of things that was 
20110112034224.000|20110112034226.000|TR0|learned and has been learned from war zone 
20110112034226.000|20110112034229.000|TR0|situations, and Dr. Reed talked about this 
20110112034229.000|20110112034231.000|TR0|-- I saw this in Iraq myself.  But, you 
20110112034231.000|20110112034233.000|TR0|know, if someone has a significant brain 
20110112034233.000|20110112034235.000|TR0|injury, the goal, the primary goal is to 
20110112034235.000|20110112034238.000|TR0|get pressure off of the brain.  That's the 
20110112034238.000|20110112034240.000|TR0|No. 1 thing you have to do.
20110112034240.000|20110112034242.000|TR0|
20110112034242.000|20110112034244.000|TR0|And what the doctors in these war zones 
20110112034244.000|20110112034247.000|TR0|have started doing was just simply 
20110112034247.000|20110112034249.000|TR0|removing lots of bone so that the brain 
20110112034249.000|20110112034251.000|TR0|has a place to swell.  We've talked about 
20110112034251.000|20110112034253.000|TR0|this.  Obviously, the congresswoman had 
20110112034253.000|20110112034256.000|TR0|this done.  And some of that has been 
20110112034256.000|20110112034258.000|TR0|directly learned from war-zone situations.
20110112034258.000|20110112034300.000|TR0|
20110112034300.000|20110112034302.000|TR0|That type of operation has been performed 
20110112034302.000|20110112034305.000|TR0|for a long time.  It was typically done 
20110112034305.000|20110112034307.000|TR0|for people who had strokes, and the brain 
20110112034307.000|20110112034309.000|TR0|sort of started to swell after a stroke.  
20110112034309.000|20110112034312.000|TR0|But after gunshot wounds, after these 
20110112034312.000|20110112034314.000|TR0|sorts of injuries, it's becoming more 
20110112034314.000|20110112034316.000|TR0|commonplace as a result of those lessons 
20110112034316.000|20110112034318.000|TR0|learned on the battlefield.
20110112034318.000|20110112034321.000|TR0|
20110112034321.000|20110112034323.000|TR0|COOPER:  Amazing.  Sanjay, thanks.  
20110112034323.000|20110112034325.000|TR0|Appreciate the expertise.
